attributes.action: Save the unearthed Roman Amphitheatre in Chester
attributes.additional_details: Cheshire West and Chester Council's Scrutiny Committee, which was considering whether or not to recommend to CWAC Council's Cabinet, for a period of public consultation on their as yet, unknown plans, to redevelop Dee House, and the land on top of the unexcavated part of Britain's Biggest Roman Amphitheatre, with an unknown developer, granting them a lease on the site, for the next 150 year
attributes.background: Chester council plan to develop Dee House, and the land on top of Britain's Biggest Amphitheatre, in Chester.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of the local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could also send your petition to Cheshire West and Chester Council here: 

http://www.cheshirewestandchester.gov.uk/your%20council/consultations%20and%20petitions/petitions.aspx
